map_node.indicator_name: Personal Use: Sprays, Bombs, or Foggers

dataset.how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area that reported personal use of pesticide sprays, bombs, or foggers, divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
dataset.discription: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

dataset.how_calculated: Estimated number of households that reported personal use of pesticide sprays, bombs, or foggers, rounded to the nearest 1,000.
dataset.discription: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

link_data_node.linkDataPagetext: The "Link Data" function shows associations between environmental health data at the neighborhood level using <a href="http://a816-dohbesp.nyc.gov/IndicatorPublic/Glossary.aspx?#Scatterplot" target="_blank">scatterplots.</a> The points represent x and y values for each NYC neighborhood. The pairs of indicators available for scatterplots were chosen because previous research suggests that one may either directly or indirectly cause or contribute to the other. Because the data being charted are <a href="http://a816-dohbesp.nyc.gov/IndicatorPublic/Glossary.aspx?#Ecological_Study" target="_blank">ecological</a> and not individual level, and because many factors contribute to the health of a population or environment, the patterns seen in these charts do not necessarily represent the underlying causal relationship.

info.y_axis_title_reg: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies
info.info_name: Homes with 3 or More Maintenance Deficiencies
info.info_how_calculated: Estimated number of households in an area reporting three or more maintenance deficiencies (heating equipment breakdown, additional heating required, rodent infestation, cracks/holes in the walls, ceilings or floors, broken plaster/peeling paint larger than 8 x 11 inches, toilet breakdowns, or water leaks from outside the unit), divided by the number of households in the area; expressed as percent.
info.info_source: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)
